design_audit.model_formula: price ~ hospwtp + system_size + lbeds + fp + year_FE + payor_FE, cluster(hosp)
design_audit.selection_story: Reduced-form pricing equation from Nash bargaining model: hospital price is determined by willingness-to-pay (WTP), hospital and system characteristics, and insurer bargaining power. Instruments include diversion-based WTP measures. Data is synthetic, calibrated to Table 5 and Table 6 estimates from Gowrisankaran, Nevo, and Town (2015 AER).

claim_object.treatment_concept: Hospital willingness-to-pay (WTP) as proxy for bargaining leverage
claim_object.estimand_concept: Effect of hospital bargaining leverage (WTP) on negotiated prices, capturing the Nash bargaining mechanism between hospitals and managed care organizations
claim_object.target_population: Hospital-insurer-year pairs in Northern Virginia hospital market (2003-2006), 6 hospital systems and multiple MCOs

constraints.notes: Reduced-form pricing equation from structural bargaining model. Controls are hospital characteristics and market structure variables. The paper estimates a structural Nash bargaining model via GMM in C; this reduced-form specification captures the key relationship between WTP and prices. Data is synthetic (calibrated to paper tables) since original microdata is confidential.
